src

Class EventClock

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.SwingWorker<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String>
      • src.GenericClock
        • src.EventClock
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Integer>, java.util.concurrent.RunnableFuture<java.lang.Integer>

    public class EventClock
extends GenericClock
    GenericClock that controls the schedule and deploymend ot the Events. EventClock extends GenericClock class. It implementes a set of methods specially designed to handle the events, like pop-up creation and ignoring-forcing events execution.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class javax.swing.SwingWorker

        javax.swing.SwingWorker.StateValue

    • Field Detail

      • periodExecutionEventList

        java.util.ArrayList<Event> periodExecutionEventList
        List of events with periodical execution. Events in this list are executed several times in a day. Its periods are usually very small (avg. 15 min).

      • singleExecutionEventList

        java.util.ArrayList<Event> singleExecutionEventList
        List of events with a single execution (fixed time of execution). Events in this list has 'startingTimes' of execution, meaning they only executes at a certain time. Their periods are equal to 24 hours.

      • newAddedEvents

        java.util.ArrayList<Event> newAddedEvents
        List of events created in execution time (while app is 'working'). By 'working' shall be understand the state of the application between the first Play button pressing and the Stop button pressing. This allows user to add events to be deployed and scheduled without stopping the application and loading a different set of events.

      • eventsToLaunch

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> eventsToLaunch
        List of event IDs to be fired inmediately, of both types. When updating the event timers, a situation when several Events shall start at the same time its possible (when timeToLaunch' reaches 0). The list stores both types of events (single and periodical execution). IDs are stored instead of Events to use less resources (integers are handled in a easier way).

      • nextPXE

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> nextPXE
        List of 'periodicalExecutionEvents' with the smallest 'timeToLaunch'. These events contains the smallest time to launch, and thus, will be the next ones to be fired (as soon as their time to launch reachs 0).

      • nextSXE

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> nextSXE
        List of 'singleExecutionEvents' with the smallest 'timeToLaunch'. These events contains the smallest time to launch, and thus, will be the next ones to be fired (as soon as their time to launch reachs 0).

      • eventLabel

        javax.swing.JLabel eventLabel
        Second label attached to this clock, used to provide feedback about events status. It is modified by the clock operations.

      • informationPopUp

        GenericPopUp informationPopUp
        Pop-up to show information about events. Permanent pop-Up, hidden or shown, with the information about: - Next PXE to be deployed OR current PXE in progress. - Single execution events.

      • timeToNextEvent

        int timeToNextEvent
        Internal clock counters. - 'timeToNextEvent' controls remain seconds to the start of next event. - 'timeToEventEnd' controls remain seconds to the end of current active events (its value concur with the biggest duration of the active events).

      • timeToEventEnd

        int timeToEventEnd
        Internal clock counters. - 'timeToNextEvent' controls remain seconds to the start of next event. - 'timeToEventEnd' controls remain seconds to the end of current active events (its value concur with the biggest duration of the active events).

      • singleExecutionInformation

        java.lang.String singleExecutionInformation
        Summarized textual data about loaded SXE. This information will be shown always in the 'eventPopUp' (it is permanent information that can be checked when pressing 'see' button in MainWindow).

      • eventInProgress

        boolean eventInProgress
        Flag to indicate if there are actually events in progress.

      • soundLoader

        SoundLoader soundLoader
        MIDI sound (file) handler.

      • isPopUpVisible

        boolean isPopUpVisible
        Pop-up behaviour control variables. Controls the visibility of the current active pop-up.

      • playSound

        boolean playSound
        Pop-up behaviour control variable. Controls if sound shall be played when pop-ups appear.

      • popUpInFront

        boolean popUpInFront
        Pop-up behaviour control variable. Controls if pop-up shall apear in front or in background.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EventClock

        public EventClock(javax.swing.JLabel timeLabel,
                  javax.swing.JLabel eventLabel)
        Initializes EventClock. EventClock needs two labels: one to print time values, and the other to print information about the events (next events or current events).
        Parameters:
        timeLabel - label to print time values (hour, minutes and seconds).
        eventLabel - label to print information about the event or events.

    • Method Detail

      • loadConfiguration

        public void loadConfiguration(ConfigLoader configuration)
        Loads the configuration into the EventClock. Configuration is composed by: - Set of events to schedule an deploy. - Environment behaviour control options (paying sounds, position of the pop-ups and behaviour of the Working Time Clock).
        Parameters:
        configuration - configuration to be loaded of ConfigLoader type.

      • generateSingleExecutionInformation

        private void generateSingleExecutionInformation()
        Generates textual summary about the Single Execution Events loaded. Summary text is composed by events starting hours and titles.

      • updateEvents

        private void updateEvents(Flags.EventType eventType)
        Updates event 'timeToLaunch' value. Events to be updated are specified by input parameter. Update operation consist in decrease 'timeToLaunch' value by one -one less second to the start of the event-. If an event reachs value zero, it is added to 'eventsToLaunch' list.
        Parameters:
        eventType - type of events to be updated (specifides the list of events to be iterated).

      • triggerEvent

        private void triggerEvent(Flags.EventType eventType)
        Executes operations related to the start of an event or events. Method triggers both visual operations (showing the pop-up) and logical operations, as status changes.
        Parameters:
        eventType - type of event being started.

      • setPXEInfo

        private void setPXEInfo()
        Sends to pop-up information regards to the Periodical Execution Events. Text format depends on the status of the events: - If there are events currently in progress, these are shown. - If there are no events in progress, next ones to be executed are shown.

      • getSXEInfo

        private java.lang.String getSXEInfo()
        Obtain information about the SXE being executed.
        Returns:
        textual information about the SXE being executed.

      • showPopUp

        public void showPopUp()
        Make the pop-up visible with the information about the events. Pop-up shall appear in frontground or background depends on the user selected configuration.

      • closePopUp

        private void closePopUp()
        Hide the pop-up.

      • searchNextEvent

        private void searchNextEvent()
        Search the next events to be deployed. Events with shortest 'timeToLaunch' are the next ones in the 'queue' to be deployed.

      • updateLabels

        private void updateLabels()
        Updates time label and event label to depict current situation. Text of both labels is updated, showing summarized information about: - Events to be deployed (time and number). - Current events in progress (time and number).

      • searchShortestEvent

        private int searchShortestEvent(java.util.ArrayList<Event> listOfEvents)
        Searchs in the specified list the event with shortest 'timeToLaunch'.
        Parameters:
        listOfEvents - list of events to iterate over.
        Returns:
        event with the shortest 'timeToLaunch'.

      • setClock

        private void setClock(int seconds)
        Establish clock time. Clock is set to a certain hour, minute and second. This time is represented by the equivalent amount of seconds.
        Parameters:
        seconds - number of seconds that represents the clock time.

      • waitEventEnd

        private void waitEventEnd()
        Decrease 'timeToEventEnd' value by one until it reaches 0. When 'timeToEventEnd' reachs 0 value, the method 'endEvent' is executed.

      • endEvent

        private void endEvent()
        Apply changes to clock in order to make the end of an event effective. This method restart several variables and give visual feedback about the completion of the events in progress.

      • updateClock

        protected void updateClock()
        Updates EventClock time, decreasing its value. Update operation decreases time value by one second. EventClock time represents remaining seconds to the starting of an event, so it shall be decreased over time. This method overrides the functionality of 'updateClock()' method from GenericClock class.
        Overrides:
        updateClock in class GenericClock
        See Also:
        GenericClock, GenericClock.updateClock()

      • ignoreEvent

        public void ignoreEvent()
        Avoids the execution of an event, or forces it to end inmediately. This method ignores current event in progress, ending them, or next events to be scheduled, cancelling its execution (event is 'jumped')

      • forceEvent

        public void forceEvent()
        Forces the start of next events to be deployed. Next events to be deployed start inmediately, no matter how many seconds remains until its activation.

      • eraseData

        private void eraseData()
        Clears internal data of the EventClock. This method returns the clock to its initial state (variables are restored to default values, same as constructor does).

      • calculateSingleExecutions

        private void calculateSingleExecutions()
        Calculate 'timeToLaunch' of each SXE. 'timeToLaunch' of SXE depends on the current system time. This value is calculated and then assigned.

      • addNewEvents

        private void addNewEvents()
        Add events created during execution time to its proper list. Events created while clocks are running are added to the proper list, being scheduled and deployed normally.

      • stopClock

        public void stopClock()
        Stops EventClock. EventClock internal data is erased and its behaviour is modified in order to finish all of its internal operations. This methods overrides the functionality of 'stopClock()' method of GenericClock class.
        Overrides:
        stopClock in class GenericClock
        See Also:
        GenericClock, GenericClock.stopClock()

      • doInBackground

        protected java.lang.Integer doInBackground()
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Core functionality of EventClock. It implements the loop operations executed by the EventClock. The method overrides the functionality of 'doInBackground()' method of SwingWorker class.
        Overrides:
        doInBackground in class GenericClock
        Returns:
        time value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - SwingWorker inherited exception.
        See Also:
        SwingWorker, SwingWorker.doInBackground()

      • getEventInProgress

        public boolean getEventInProgress()
        Returns:
        True if there are events in progress.

      • getNewAddedEvents

        public java.util.ArrayList<Event> getNewAddedEvents()
        Returns:
        ArrayList of new events to be added in execution time.

      • getPXE

        public java.util.ArrayList<Event> getPXE()
        Returns:
        ArrayList of Periodical Execution Events loaded in the app.

      • getSXE

        public java.util.ArrayList<Event> getSXE()
        Returns:
        ArrayList of Single Execution Events loaded in the app.
